meanings.definition: At or in which place or situation.
meanings.sent1: She looked around, trying to figure out whereat she had left her keys.
meanings.sent2: He pointed to the map, indicating whereat the treasure was buried.
meanings.sent3: The cat sat on the windowsill, pondering whereat to take a nap.
meanings.sent4: The old house, whereat many memories were made, stood silent and empty.
meanings.sent5: The forest, whereat the trees whispered secrets, was a place of mystery.

meanings.sent1: She missed the bus, whereat she had to walk to school.
meanings.sent2: He forgot his umbrella, whereat he got soaked in the rain.
meanings.sent3: The cake was burnt, whereat they decided to order pizza instead.
meanings.sent4: The meeting ran late, whereat they had to reschedule their dinner plans.
meanings.sent5: The alarm didn't go off, whereat they overslept and were late for work.
